author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Friday that directs the Department of Defense to be known as the Department of War.
 
The move restores a name the agency last held in the 1940s and, according to the text of the order seen by the BBC, the aim is to "project strength and resolve".
 
The department will initially use the new name as a "secondary title" while the administration seeks congressional approval to make the change permanent.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#DonaldTrump #DepartmentOfWar #BBCNews
title: Donald Trump rebrands Department of Defense as Department of War | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, Angela Rayner has resigned from her role as deputy prime minister after an investigation concluded she had breached the UK governments' ministerial code by underpaying stamp duty on a flat in Hove. The Prime Minister, Sir Keir Starmer accepted her resignation "with real sadness".

The report into Rayner’s conduct concluded she had ‘acted with integrity’ but had failed to meet the standards of the ministerial code by not looking for expert tax advice. Her resignation triggered a major cabinet reshuffle with former foreign secretary, David Lammy replacing her as deputy prime minister. Her resignation is also likely to spark a contest for the role of deputy leader of the Labour party. 

James Cook is joined by Chris Mason and Laura Kuenssberg, to chat who’s in, who’s out, and how ‘Phase Two’ is shaping up for the Government.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews #UKGovernment #Politics
title: Angela Rayner resigns sparking major UK government reshuffle | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
Xi Jinping welcomed Vladimir Putin and a host of other world leaders to Beijing this week, as the Russian president continued his re-emergence on the diplomatic stage. But while President Xi talked up new non-western alliances, the status quo continued in Europe as the ‘Coalition of the Willing’ convened in Paris.
 
Amid two competing visions of global leadership, and the notable absence of Donald Trump, has this week changed anything for Ukraine? To discuss, Lucy Hockings and Vitaly Shevchenko are joined by the BBC’s chief international correspondent, Lyse Doucet.

What do you think of Ukrainecast? Have your say: bit.ly/ukrainecastfeedback

Listen to the full episode here: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0m0wh14

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news

#Ukraine #Russia #BBCNews
title: Does China want Russia to win the war in Ukraine? | BBC Ukrainecast

author: BBC News
description:
Nigel Farage has told Reform UK members they must be ready for an early general election, following the resignation of the UK's deputy prime minister Angela Rayner over her failure to pay enough tax on a property. 
 
The Reform leader took to the stage for his keynote conference speech in Birmingham, UK, three hours earlier than planned after Rayner announced her resignation.
 
He announced the setting up of a new department to prepare for government, with former Reform chairman Zia Yusuf as head of policy.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#UK #UKPolitcs #BBCNews
title: Reform UK must be ready for 'early' election, Nigel Farage says at party conference | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Admiral Sir Tony Radakin has just stepped down from being Chief of the Defence Staff. 
 
In his exit interview, on BBC Radio 4's Political Thinking podcast, he said the UK was safe "for now and for a few years".
 
He claimed that Putin's full-scale invasion of Ukraine had been "a disaster for Russia".
 
You can watch the interview on BBC iPlayer or listen to an extended version on BBC Sounds.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: UK safe and Ukraine war "a disaster for Russia" says outgoing military chief | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
In an interview with Amol Rajan for his BBC podcast, Radical, Amodei explains how his company’s technology has been used by hackers to carry out sophisticated cyber attacks.
 
Anthropic, which makes the chatbot Claude, says its tools were used by hackers "to commit large-scale theft and extortion of personal data".
 
It was able to disrupt the threat actors and has reported the cases to the authorities along with improving its detection tools.
 
Amodei, who used to work for OpenAI, also explains why he thinks there needs to be more regulation of artificial intelligence and criticises other technology companies for lobbying against it.
 
You can listen to the full interview on BBC Sounds: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/m002ht32
 
You can watch it on BBC iPlayer: https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/m002f1g2/radical-with-amol-rajan-an-artificial-intelligence-boss-warns-of-the-technologys-risks

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bb
title: Leading AI boss warns about risks of the technology | BBC News

title: US Senator claims eating radioactive shrimp will make you look like 'alien from Alien'. #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
US President Donald Trump has suggested he will send National Guard troops to Chicago, saying "we're going in", when asked about a possible deployment.
 
The president has claimed crime is out of control in the city, even though FBI data shows the murder rate falling in recent years.
 
Trump has already deployed the National Guard to Washington DC, BBC Verify's Nick Beake looks at whether he can do the same in Chicago.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#US #BBCNews
title: Can Trump send National Guard troops to Chicago? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The Duchess of Kent has died at the age of 92, Buckingham Palace has announced with "deep sorrow".
 
She "passed away peacefully last night at Kensington Palace, surrounded by her family", a statement said on Friday, with the flag on Buckingham Palace now lowered to half mast.
 
The duchess, Katharine, was the oldest member of the Royal Family, married to Prince Edward, the Duke of Kent, a first cousin of the late Queen Elizabeth II.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#UK #BBCNews
title: The Duchess of Kent dies aged 92 | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Angela Rayner has resigned as the UK's deputy prime minister, housing secretary and deputy leader of the Labour Party over failing to pay enough tax on a flat in Hove, East Sussex.
 
Rayner referred herself to the PM's ethics adviser earlier this week, after admitting underpaying stamp duty on her £800,000 flat. 
 
An ethics report found she breached the ministerial code and "did not heed the caution" in legal advice she received. In her resignation letter, she said she takes "full responsibility" for the "error".
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#UK #UKPolitics #BBCNews
title: Angela Rayner resigns from UK government over tax row | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Thailand's parliament has chosen business tycoon Anutin Charnvirakul as the country's prime minister - the third in two years, after yet another leader was removed from office.
 
Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who belongs to Thailand's most powerful political dynasty, was removed by the constitutional court last week for ethical violations over her handling of the border dispute with Cambodia.
 
Anutin's Bhumjaithai party broke from the coalition led by the Shinawatras' Pheu Thai, and secured enough support in parliament to win the premiership.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Thailand #BBCNews
title: Thailand names third prime minister in two years | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Three British nationals were killed in the Lisbon funicular crash, Portuguese police have said.
 
The Glória funicular, a popular tourist attraction, derailed and crashed into a building on Wednesday, killing 16.
 
More than 20 people were also injured, with five in a critical condition.
 
It is still unclear what caused the crash. The capital's public transport operator, Carris, said all funiculars would be inspected and that it had launched an independent investigation.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#Lisbon #BBCNews
title: Three Brits killed in Lisbon funicular crash, say Portuguese police | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin has rejected the idea of a "reassurance force" in Ukraine after any ceasefire comes into place.
 
At a Paris summit aimed at finalising plans for security guarantees, French President Emmanuel Macron said 26 of Ukraine's allies had formally committed to deploying troops "by land, sea or air" after a ceasefire.
 
President Putin’s spokesman Dmitry Peskov told the BBC’s Russia editor Steve Rosenberg that the pledge “…will not help us get closer to the solution of the Ukrainian conflict."

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#Kremlin #Russia 
#BBCNews
title: BBC doorsteps Putin's spokesperson on Western support for Ukraine | BBC News
